content: Stream created by Santiago Pastorino.
@WG-prioritization have created this stream and subscribed everyone that is signed up on #t-compiler/wg-prioritization
so we can move our alerts here and leave the other stream for discussions
Oh this is great
created @WG-prioritization/alerts too
for now I've copied everyone
@LeSeulArtichaut now we need to change triagebot to make it open all the topics here and ping the alerts group
people that do not want to be on alerts group, let me know and I can remove them
All we need is the ID of the stream
yep
how do you want to make this change? would it make sense to place everything in #73695 or should we just merge that and fix this afterwards?
Can you fetch it for me? I’m on my phone rn :D
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/245100-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization.2Falerts
I guess is that number, right?

Santiago Pastorino said:

people that do not want to be on alerts group, let me know and I can remove them

Apparently I was able to just remove myself :laughing: I might want to get added back in once I have more free time again, will see how well it works without getting pinged
Yes that’s it
@LeSeulArtichaut I'd suggest to not remove pings for the topics as a way to start with this schema
but unsure, I guess you should define because I'm going to remove myself from the group cause I check that preemptively
@lcnr you can unsubscribe/subscribe to streams whenever you want :slight_smile: (that should also take care of the notification iirc)
Yeah, but I wasn't sure if it's possible to enter/exit groups
^ exit :check_mark: enter :cross_mark:
IIUC you can manage a group if you’re part or it?
yeah, I think I can even remove other people
which I didn't try though
Me neither :D

@Santiago Pastorino I think this problem is quite complex, because I can see 2 possible kinds of people:

  • ppl who want to get notified
  • ppl who don’t want to be notified but want to still follow along and participate in discussions

Also eventually ppl may also not want to be flooded by messages, even if they don’t ping.

The solution would be to use this stream and the new ping, so that ppl in 1) can get notified while ppl in 2) can follow the discussions without getting pinged. And also eventually if ppl want to ignore those notifs they can unsubscribe from this stream.
yes and also people can mute this stream
but I guess you guys should decide in which topics of this stream you want to ping
I-prioritize seems to be a clear one
unsure about the rest
I guess lcnr was the one that didn't want to be pinged and they are going to unsubscribe so I think I'd just ping on all the streams as we are currently doing

Santiago Pastorino said:

so we can move our alerts here and leave the other stream for discussions

what does that mean? what are "alerts"?

I am subscribed to the prioritization stream (what an unspellable word^^) just because I get mentioned sometimes, I don't actually follow the discussions -- so I guess I can unsubscribe the alert stream?
@RalfJ alerts are when issues get requested for prioritisation , nomination and the like
so whenever the label is added, it mentions the group here and creates a thread for it
but the thread is in the main stream?
I think the main stream is now only for meetings and discussions...
All threads created automatically will be created here
you can probably unsubscribe wg-prioritization and only mute wg-prioritization/alerts
right, probably for people that do not belong to the working group is more interesting to be in this group and not in the other one
#t-compiler/wg-prioritization will be for meetings and discussions about our process and things like that
#t-compiler/wg-prioritization/alerts will be about issues and we will be discussing issues here

RalfJ said:

I am subscribed to the prioritization stream (what an unspellable word^^) just because I get mentioned sometimes, I don't actually follow the discussions -- so I guess I can unsubscribe the alert stream?

so answering your question more concretely, you would want to be in this one for sure but unsure if you want to follow discussions about our process :)

it may be too late for me to complain about this, but: For me on zulip, the presentation of the side bar cannot be widened, and so streams with long matching prefixes are not distinguishable (other than remembering which one comes first)
I guess this is my way of saying "gee it maybe would have been better if we had figured out a different name for this stream, one where some difference occurs early in the string."
but then again, I suppose it is a good thing that these two streams are neighbors in the list (and probably always will be...)
It seems fine to me to name it prioritization-alerts, though that would "break" the patterns used everywhere else
And also break the alphabetical order, right, didn't think about that
wg-prio might work?
yes the streams are indistinguishable by reading the text. But colors are different (at least on my client), that helps me a bit
2020-07-01_185350.png
I set the "main" prioritization stream to light blue and this stream to dark blue so I know which is which thanks to colors too
I see the colors but an easier way to differentiate between the streams is by the content
this stream should all be about issues and the other one should be about general discussions
image.png
vs
image.png
and also ...
image.png
the ... dots there :)
ah i thought everyone had the same colours (though i remember seeing a place where you can change it )
anyway, I'm not opposed to change names if it's better for the rest
i have a nice contrasting yellow and purple :D
maybe we could flip it to `t-compiler/alerts-wg-prioritisation
I think all WGs streams tend to have long names
So maybe we could do something for all WGs? Would not including the team name (e.g. wg-prioritization) be fine?
